bill_title: provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 47-22 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Before a nonprofit corporation in the regular course of business or in the provision of services requests that a person provide the person's social security number, the corporation shall adopt a privacy protection policy that sets forth the manner in which the corporation intends to secure and protect any social security numbers in its possession or in the possession of a third party with whom the corporation shares or will share the numbers. The policy must specify measures that limit access to social security numbers and processes and procedures that mitigate against the improper disclosure of social security numbers. The corporation shall: (1) Provide the policy to all employees and agents; (2) Post the policy on the corporation's website, if one exists; (3) Post the policy at the corporation's place of business, in a location that is readily accessible to employees, volunteers, and members of the public; and (4) Make the policy available in printed form, upon request. The Bureau of Information and Telecommunications shall, in concert with the attorney general, develop and post sample policies that meet the requirements of this section on the bureau's website.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 47-22 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Before a nonprofit corporation in the regular course of business or in the provision of services requests that a person provide the person's social security number, the corporation shall adopt a privacy protection policy that sets forth the manner in which the corporation intends to secure and protect any social security numbers in its possession or in the possession of a third party with whom the corporation shares or will share the numbers. The policy must specify measures that limit access to social security numbers and processes and procedures that mitigate against the improper disclosure of social security numbers. The corporation shall: (1) Provide the policy to all employees and agents; (2) Post the policy on the corporation's website, if one exists; (3) Post the policy at the corporation's place of business, in a location that is readily accessible to employees, volunteers, and members of the public; and (4) Make the policy available in printed form, upon request. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 47-22 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Before a nonprofit corporation in the regular course of business or in the provision of services requests that a volunteer provide the volunteer's social security number, the corporation shall adopt a privacy protection policy that sets forth the manner in which the corporation intends to secure and protect any social security numbers in its possession or in the possession of a third party with whom the corporation shares or will share the numbers. The policy must specify measures that limit access to social security numbers and processes and procedures that mitigate against the improper disclosure of social security numbers. The corporation shall: (1) Provide the policy to all volunteers; and (2) Make the policy available in printed form, upon request. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 47-22 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Before a nonprofit corporation in the regular course of business or in the provision of services requests that a volunteer provide the volunteer's social security number, the corporation shall adopt a privacy protection policy that sets forth the manner in which the corporation intends to secure and protect any social security numbers in its possession or in the possession of a third party with whom the corporation shares or will share the numbers. The policy must specify measures that limit access to social security numbers and processes and procedures that mitigate against the improper disclosure of social security numbers. The corporation shall: (1) Provide the policy to any volunteer who provided the volunteer's social security number to the nonprofit corporation; and (2) Make the policy available in printed form, upon request. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the adoption of privacy protection policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 47-22 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Before a nonprofit corporation in the regular course of business or in the provision of services requests that a volunteer provide the volunteer's social security number, the corporation shall adopt a privacy protection policy that sets forth the manner in which the corporation intends to secure and protect any social security numbers in its possession or in the possession of a third party with whom the corporation shares or will share the numbers. The policy must specify measures that limit access to social security numbers and processes and procedures that mitigate against the improper disclosure of social security numbers. The corporation shall: (1) Provide the policy to any volunteer who has been requested to provide the volunteer's social security number to the nonprofit corporation; and (2) Make the policy available in printed form, upon request. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
